feats.name: Dragon Spit
feats.description: Many Tian-Dan claim to have dragon blood in their veins, and in your case, this is true—you can spit.

innate.name: Electric Arc
innate.description: An arc of lightning leaps from one target to another. You deal 1d4+4 electricity damage to the target creatures. The targets must attempt a basic Reflex save.

feats.name: Dragon Stance
feats.description: You enter the stance of a dragon and make powerful leg strikes like a lashing dragon's tail. You can make dragon tail attacks that deal 1d10 bludgeoning damage. They are in the brawling group and have the backswing, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

actions.name: Dragon Stance
actions.description: You enter the stance of a dragon and make powerful leg strikes like a lashing dragon's tail. You can make dragon tail attacks that deal 1d10 bludgeoning damage. They are in the brawling group and have the backswing, nonlethal, and unarmed traits. While in Dragon Stance, you can ignore the first square of difficult terrain while Striding.

strikes.name: Dragon Tail Strike
strikes.description: You swing your leg through the air like a dragon swiping with its tail. You can only use this when you are in Dragon Stance.

feats.name: Qi Spells
feats.description: You can tap into your inner qi to cast special spells called qi spells. You gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You learn the ki strike and wholeness of body qi spells.

feats.name: Battle Medicine
feats.description: You can patch up yourself or an adjacent ally, even in combat. Attempt a Medicine check with the same DC as for Treat Wounds and restore a corresponding amount of Hit Points. This doesn't remove the wounded condition.

actions.name: Battle Medicine
actions.description: You can patch up wounds, even in combat. Attempt a Medicine check with the same DC as for Treat Wounds and restore the corresponding amount of HP; this doesn’t remove the wounded condition. As with Treat Wounds, you can attempt checks against higher DCs if you have the minimum proficiency rank. The target is then immune to your Battle Medicine for 1 day. This does not make them immune to, or otherwise count as, Treat Wounds.

feats.name: Godless Healing
feats.description: You recover more Hit Points from effects that only grant healing. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Hit Points regained by effects that only grant healing.

feats.name: Quick Repair
feats.description: You can Repair items quickly. You can Repair items in half the normal time (minimum 1 minute). If you're a master in Crafting, you can Repair items in one-quarter the normal time (minimum 1 minute).

feats.name: Draconic Ravager
feats.description: You have begun to focus your draconic magic from within into your body, giving you dragon-like features like claws, sharpened teeth, and scales, making you a fearsome sight to behold. You gain claw (1d6) and jaw (1d8) unarmed attacks that have the agile and finesse traits. Your eyes have also sharpened, giving you Darkvision.

strikes.name: Dragon Claw
strikes.description: Rend their flesh with your draconic claws.

strikes.name: Dragon Bite
strikes.description: Bite into your foe with magically sharp dragon teeth.

feats.name: Staunch Bleeding
feats.description: You know how to pack an injury properly to stop bleeding.

actions.name: Staunch Bleeding
actions.description: As a single action you can Treat Wounds to stop someone from bleeding; if you use two actions the DC is reduced by 10.

inventory.name: Backpack
inventory.description: A backpack for holding your gear

contents.name: Bedroll
contents.description: A compact mat, not too comfy but suitable for long journeys.

contents.name: Chalk
contents.description: Suitable for marking hard surfaces temporarily.

contents.name: Flint & Steel
contents.description: A camper's classic for starting fires.

contents.name: Rope (50ft)
contents.description: Sturdy rope for tying something (or someone) down.

contents.name: Rations
contents.description: While they don't taste amazing, rations offer enough nutrition to keep you from starving. Each pack can feed a single person for a day.

contents.name: Torch
contents.description: A torch sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet) for 1 hour. It can be used as an improvised weapon that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage plus 1 fire damage when lit.

contents.name: Waterskin
contents.description: When it's full, a waterskin contains roughly 1 day's worth of water for a Small or Medium creature.

inventory.name: Spacious Pouch
inventory.description: Though it appears to be a cloth bag decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a spacious pouch opens into a magical space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the spacious pouch itself. The amount of Bulk the bag's extradimensional space can hold depends on its type. You can Interact with the spacious pouch to stow items in it or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside. If the bag is overloaded or broken, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. If it's turned inside out, the items inside spill out unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. A living creature placed inside the bag has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to Escape against a DC of 13. An item inside the bag provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. An item in the bag can't be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.

contents.name: Sterling Artisan's Tools (Talismans)
contents.description: An incredibly high-quality set of artisan tools, perfectly suited to creating Talismans. If you use them when you Craft a Talisman, you get a +1 item bonus to the check.

contents.name: Anticorrosion Oil
contents.description: You can coat objects of 6 Bulk or less with anticorrosion oil. For 24 hours, the object takes half damage from acid and from all effects that specifically cause it to rust or corrode, such as contact with a rust monster's antennae.

contents.name: Oil of Weightlessness
contents.description: You can spread this shimmering oil on an item of 1 Bulk or less to make it feel weightless. It has negligible Bulk for 1 hour.

contents.name: Moderate Drakeheart Mutagen
contents.description: Your skin grows scales like a drake, and your eyesight become sharp and your pupils slitted, but your mind and reflexes slow. You gain a +5 Item bonus to AC, a Dexterity cap of +2 (as usual, use your lowest Dexterity cap if you have more than one), and a +2 item bonus to Perception checks. If you're wearing armor, you still calculate your proficiency bonus to AC based on your proficiency in the armor you're wearing, even if the drakeheart mutagen has a higher item bonus. While under its effects, you take a –1 penalty to Will saves, Reflex saves, and all skill checks to Recall Knowledge. As a single action, you can burn through the remaining duration of the Mutagen to stride twice.

contents.name: Eye Garnets
contents.description: Large red rubies you pried from a statue of Xar-Azmak.

contents.name: Rusty, Broken Full Plate Armor
contents.description: Large red rubies you pried from a statue of Xar-Azmak.

contents.name: Midnight Milk
contents.description: The strange, swirling liquid in this bottle is said to give those who injest it a feeling of drowsy euphoria as it lulls them to sleep. It is a new drug, making its way into surface markets via trade routes in the Darklands.

inventory.name: Minor Healing Potion
inventory.description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a minor healing potion, it restores 1d8 HP when consumed

inventory.name: Minor Elixir of Life
inventory.description: Elixirs of life accelerate a living creature's natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain 1d6 Hit Points and gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

inventory.name: Potion of Waterbreathing
inventory.description: This filmy, gray potion reeks of ocean detritus and tastes even worse. After drinking this potion, you gain the ability to breathe underwater for 1 hour.

inventory.name: Mysterious Blue Orb
inventory.description: Streaks of blue shimmer within the smoky depths of this perfect crystalline sphere. Both the scintillating shade and emanations of an indefinable power suggest that something slumbers within. When all is quiet, Blu can feel it pulling at him.

inventory.name: Sanitizing Pin
inventory.description: This pin includes a piece of gauze wrapped around a dried herbal poultice. When you activate the sanitizing pin, the poultice dissolves and bolsters your body's defense against poison or disease. You gain a +2 status bonus on your Fortitude save against the initial exposure to the affliction. If you roll a critical failure on the triggering attempt, you get a failure instead.

inventory.name: Rust Scrub
inventory.description: This salt scrub is infused with citron juice and alchemical ingredients that allow it to fight rust on metallic equipment. One application can be used to restore 2d4 Hit Points to an item that has been damaged by rust. The GM determines what portion of damage to an item was caused by rust if that value isn't known.

inventory.name: Shuriken
inventory.description: This “throwing star” is a small piece of flat metal with sharp edges, designed to be flung with a flick of the wrist.

stances.name: Dragon Stance
stances.description: You enter the stance of a dragon and make powerful leg strikes like a lashing dragon's tail. You can make dragon tail attacks that deal 1d10 bludgeoning damage. They are in the brawling group and have the backswing, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.
stances.restrictions: You can use this action only while in Dragon Stance.

ki_spells.name: Inner Upheaval
ki_spells.description: You focus your qi into devastating magical attacks. Make an unarmed Strike or Flurry of Blows (this doesn't change the limit on using only one flourish per turn). You gain a +1 status bonus to your attack rolls with the Strikes, and the Strikes deal 1d6 extra damage. This damage can be any of the following types of your choice, chosen each time you Strike: force, spirit, vitality, or void.

actions.name: Flurry of Blows
actions.description: Make two unarmed Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses. Apply your multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally. As a flourish ability, you can use Flurry of Blows only once per turn.
